intro: Agalmyla clarkei, commonly known as Clarke's agalmyla, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
